data.label: Cloud Architecture Framework
data.shortDescription: The Architecture Framework describes best practices, provides implementation recommendations, and explains some of the available products and services. The framework helps you design your Google Cloud deployment so that it matches your business needs.

data.label: Operational excellence
data.shortDescription: Efficiently deploy, operate, monitor, and manage your cloud workloads.

data.label: Security, privacy, and compliance
data.shortDescription: Maximize the security of your data and workloads in the cloud, design for privacy, and align with regulatory requirements and standards.

data.label: Reliability
data.shortDescription: Design and operate resilient and highly available workloads in the cloud.

data.label: System Design
data.shortDescription: Best Practices and Recommendations to define the architecture, components, modules, interfaces, and data needed to satisfy cloud system requirements,

data.label: Cost Optimization
data.shortDescription: Maximize the business value of your investment in Google Cloud.

data.label: Performance Optimization
data.shortDescription: Design and tune your cloud resources for optimal performance.

data.label: Documentation
data.shortDescription: Fosters communication, guides design decisions, and aids in onboarding new team members. Change logs track evolution and aid performance measurement.

data.label: Keep it simple stupid
data.shortDescription: Simplicity is crucial in system design. Use managed services, start with a minimal viable product, and iterate for improvements.

data.label: Decouple
data.shortDescription: Decoupling separates applications into smaller components, enabling independent operation. Benefits include flexibility in upgrades, security, reliability, monitoring, performance, and cost control.

data.label: Go Stateless
data.shortDescription: Stateless architecture enhances application reliability and scalability. Stateful applications rely on dependencies, while stateless apps use shared storage and cached services for increased scalability, resilience, and performance.

data.label: Fault Tolerance/Resiliency/DR
data.shortDescription: Ensure fault-tolerance, resiliency, disaster recovery by deploying to multi regions or zones.

data.label: Compliance/Regulations
data.shortDescription: Constraint use to certain regions to meet geographic regulatory or compliance regulations (e.g. GDPR)

data.label: Service availability
data.shortDescription: Although most services are available for all regions, some enterprise-specific services might be available in a subset of regions

data.label: Tags and Labels
data.shortDescription: Use tags and labels (early) for access control, monitoring and billing

data.label: Resource Hierachies
data.shortDescription: Google Cloud resources are arranged hierarchically in organizations, folders, and projects. This hierarchy lets you manage common aspects of your resources like access control, configuration settings, and policies

data.label: Automate
data.shortDescription: Automate the creation of resources

data.label: Enforce
data.shortDescription: Enforce standardized policies, name conventions, billing policies, compliance requirements across you gcp resources

data.label: Restrict
data.shortDescription:
Restrict use of services, specific regions 
 or actions (e.g creation of service account keys, sharing of resources) with org. policies

data.label: Chose
data.shortDescription: Serverless (Cloud Run, Cloud Functions, ..), Kubernetes or VM (Compute Engine) based on your workload and migration approach (lift-shift, rip-replace etc.)

data.label: Workload VPC architecture
data.shortDescription:
Identify decision makers, timelines, and pre-work.Consider VPC network design early.
Keep it simple. Use clear naming conventions.

data.label: Sustainablity
data.shortDescription: Use regions based on minimal carbon footprint

data.label: Latency
data.shortDescription: To reduce latency, choose regions close to your users

data.label: Cloud SQL
data.shortDescription: managed database service on Google Cloud, offering performance, scalability, and administration for PostgreSQL, MySQL, and SQL Server.

data.label: BigTable
data.shortDescription: highly scalable NoSQL database for storing massive amounts of single-keyed data with low latency

data.label: Spanner
data.shortDescription: Scalable, globally distributed database with high-performance transactions, consistency, and enterprise-grade security.

data.label: Memorystore
data.shortDescription: fully managed Redis service

data.label: Firestore
data.shortDescription: NoSQL document database built for automatic scaling, high performance, and application development

data.label: AlloyDB
data.shortDescription: ully managed PostgreSQL-compatible database service for demanding enterprise workloads

data.label: Open Source Databases
data.shortDescription: Google partners offer different open source databases, including MongoDB, MariaDB, and Redis.

data.label: Scale
data.shortDescription: Scale easily by using managed services (Cloud Run, or GKE Autoscaler, etc), automation or startup/shutdown scripts for VMs and Managed Instance Groups

data.label: Network Infrastrucutre
data.shortDescription: optimize for performance and secure application communications with internal and external services

data.label: manage
data.shortDescription: Set storage life cycle rules, assign unique & randomized names, keep buckets private

data.label: Cloud Storage
data.shortDescription: store data at scale at the lowest cost, and access performance is not an issue.

data.label: Persistent Disk/SSD
data.shortDescription: compute applications that need immediate storage.

data.label: Filestore
data.shortDescription: high-performance workloads that need read and write access to shared space.

data.label: BigQuery
data.shortDescription: Serverless, scalable Data Warehouse of Terra- or Petabytes of data

data.label: PubSub
data.shortDescription: Scalable messaging service for asynchronous communication, enabling decoupled and reliable data exchange.

data.label: DataFlow
data.shortDescription: fully managed, serverless data processing service for building and executing data pipelines

data.label: Dataprep
data.shortDescription: Intelligent data service to visually explore, clean, and prepare structured and unstructured data for analysis.

data.label: Dataproc
data.shortDescription: Fast, easy-to-use, and fully managed cloud service to run Apache Spark and Apache Hadoop clusters.

data.label: BigQuery
data.shortDescription: analyze terabytes to petabytes of data.

data.label: Datafusion
data.shortDescription: fully managed,graphical data integration service for building and managing data pipelines

data.label: Automate
data.shortDescription: Reduce manual, repetitive work without lasting value (toil) through automation for efficiency and accuracy.

data.label: Logging, Monitoring, Alerting
data.shortDescription: "The process of collecting, analyzing, and using information to track applications and infrastructure in order to guide business decisions. Monitoring is a key capability because it gives you insight into your systems and your work."

data.label: Cloud Support and escalation processes
data.shortDescription: Create a well-defined escalation process to quickly respond to issues. Set up for proper communication

data.label: Peak traffic and launch events
data.shortDescription: Plan specifically for peak events (e.g. launch, black-friday) that cause a sharp increase in traffic beyond the standard baseline

data.label: Assets
data.shortDescription: Understand, automate and monitor your assets, their value and related critical processes (e.g do my assets deviate from my standards ?)

data.label: Identity & Access
data.shortDescription: ensure that the right people can access the right resources

data.label: Compliance
data.shortDescription: Asses and monitor you organizational, customers and industry regulatory requirements. Use approved blue prints and automate deployments

data.label: Incident Management
data.shortDescription: Build a collaborative incident management process

data.label: Observability
data.shortDescription: add observability into your services so that you can better understand your service performance and quickly identify issues. Includes monitoring, logging, tracing, profiling, debugging, and similar systems

data.label: Design for Scalability & High Availability
data.shortDescription: Built systems that can tolerate failures and scale in response to customer demand

data.label: CI/CD
data.shortDescription: Automate deployments with Google Cloud's CI/CD tools, increasing velocity and productivity.

data.label: Infrastructure as Code
data.shortDescription: Automate infrastructure management, treat changes like app changes, and enable rollbacks.

data.label: Testing, Testing, ...
data.shortDescription: Continuous testing helps teams create high-quality software faster and enhance software stability.Unit, Integration, System, Load, Securitytests, ...

data.label: Gradual Deployments
data.shortDescription: Pick a deployment strategy such as rolling updates, blue/green deployments, and canary deployments

data.label: Monitore Pipelines
data.shortDescription: Use logs and alerts to check if a pipeline performs smoothly

data.label: Establish Guidelines
data.shortDescription: ensure that your management guidelines for releasing new software versions are clearly documented.

data.label: Culture of Automation
data.shortDescription: Review current toil, communicate and enforce culture of automation

data.label: Create Plan
data.shortDescription: Start early in setting up a plan what and how to monitor your business (cloud, on-prem, ..)

data.label: Define Metrics
data.shortDescription: Define the metrics that are required to measure how your deployments behaves and create SLOs, SLIs

data.label: Set up Monitoring and Alerting
data.shortDescription: Use platform independent and managed Monitoring Service

data.label: Build Dashboards
data.shortDescription: Create easy and quick to understand visualizations of your systems performance

data.label: Logging
data.shortDescription: Set up Cloud Logging and Cloud Audit Logs ("Who did what, where, when")

data.label: Evaluate Current State
data.shortDescription: Identify workloads, usage-patterns and involved teams. Analyze metrics (utilization, spikes) to gain insight into the systems usage and capacity

data.label: Create Plan
data.shortDescription: Establish a process for capacity planning and document this plan. Including Load Tests, Forecasting and Cost Planning

data.label: Set Up Quoats
data.shortDescription: Decrease quotas to limit overconsumption. Increase for scalability

data.label: Shared Fate
data.shortDescription: Extends Shared Responsibility by providing additional security layers, best practices and ready-to-use configurations

data.label: Shared Responsiblity
data.shortDescription: Collective accountability for security and compliance between Google Cloud and its users for a secure environment.

data.label: Automate
data.shortDescription: Especially consider automating sensitive tasks to reduce human induced erroes

data.label: Assure Compliance
data.shortDescription: Comply with regulations like GDPR by e.g. obfuscating or redacting personally identifiable information

data.label: Start early
data.shortDescription: Incorporate security processes from the start

data.label: Mitigate Risks
data.shortDescription: using technical controls, contractual protections, and third-party verifications or attestations

data.label: Assess risks
data.shortDescription: complete a risk assessment to determine what security features you need in order to meet your internal security requirements and external regulatory requirements.

data.label: Protect the super admin
data.shortDescription: Take extra cautions around the super admin account

data.label: Use a dedicated identity provideru
data.shortDescription: Make use of a single identity provider. Connect to outside of Google Cloud (federation or active directory) or use Googles Identity or Workspace

data.label: Least Privilege & Separation of Duties
data.shortDescription: ensure that the right individuals get access only to the resources and services that they need in order to perform their jobs

data.label: Audit access
data.shortDescription: Use Cloud Audit logs to monitor activities of privileged accounts and users

data.label: Restrict and automate
data.shortDescription: Use tags, IAM conditions, organizational policies and Service Controls in an automated manner

data.label: Confidental Computing
data.shortDescription: Encripts data in memory for Compute Engine or GKE

data.label: Shielded VMS
data.shortDescription: Extra security by preventing code from being loaded during the boot process

data.label: Control access
data.shortDescription: Control access via OS Login, IAM, Service Controls or RBCA (GKE)

data.label: Disable public IPs
data.shortDescription: Disable external IPs, set GKE or Composer to private. If outbund connectivity is required, use Cloud NAT

data.label: Classify Data
data.shortDescription: Public, Internal, Confidental, Restricted. Use Cloud DLP

data.label: Data Governance via Metadata
data.shortDescription: Find, cureate, and use metadata for your data with data catalog, tag data, restrict access and find confidential data with DLP

data.label: Encryption
data.shortDescription: By default, all data is encrypted by google. Encrypt data with Customer-managed encryption keys or customer-supplied encryption keys

data.label: Control Access
data.shortDescription: Control the network locations from which users can access data by using VPC Service Controls and IAM

data.label: Monitor activity around data
data.shortDescription: Use Cloud Audit Logs, Cloud Monitoring and Security Command Center

data.label: Data sovereignty
data.shortDescription: Prevent Google from accessing your data by e.g using CSEK or using confidental machines

data.label: Operational sovereignty
data.shortDescription: Restrict deployments of resources to specific regions or limit google access

data.label: Software sovereignty
data.shortDescription: Prevent vendor lock-in by using multi/hybrid clouds

data.label: Data residency
data.shortDescription: Understand data types and locations, examine risks, laws regulations and dataflow

data.label: Privacy requirements
data.shortDescription: Classify Data (DLP), prevent access (IAM or MFA), monitor access and enforce Zero Trust

data.label: Monitor Network Performance
data.shortDescription: Network Intelligence Center gives you insights into how your network topology and achritecutre are performing

data.label: Centralize monitoring
data.shortDescription: prevent, detect, and respond to threats by using Security Command Center, Event Threat Detection, and/or Chronicle

data.label: Service level indicator (SLI)
data.shortDescription: Metric measuring service performance, usually expressed as a percentage

data.label: Service level objective (SLO)
data.shortDescription: Specific target for service performance, quantifiable and time-bound. Target value for SLI

data.label: Error Budget
data.shortDescription: Allowable margin of errors for service performance. Measured in SLO/Time

data.label: Service level agreement (SLA)
data.shortDescription: Contractual agreement defining service expectations and responsibilities

data.label: Reliability is defined by the user
Reliability and rapid innovation are complementary
Reduce time to detect (TTD)
data.shortDescription: A well-tuned set of SLIs alerts your team at the right time without alert overload

data.label: Reduce time to mitigate
data.shortDescription: Define a documented and well-exercised incident management plan

data.label: Document
data.shortDescription: Document diagnostic procedures and mitigation for known outage scenarios

data.label: Set up incident review process
data.shortDescription: Establish a blameless postmortem culture and an incident review process

data.label: Alerts
data.shortDescription: Design your alerts for early and accurate detection of all user-impacting system problems, and minimize false positives

data.label: Alert on symtops rather than causes
Alert on outlier values rather than averages
New Node
data.shortDescription: Optimize the alert delay

data.label: Processes & Tools
data.shortDescription: Create reliable operational processes and tools

data.label: Spread out traffic for timed spikes
Use multi-zone architecture
data.shortDescription: Utilize distributed resource pools across multiple zones for zonal failure protection

data.label: replicate data for disaster recover
data.shortDescription: Data replication or archiving across regions enables disaster recovery for regional outages or data loss

data.label: Use multi-regions
data.shortDescription: Use distributed compute resources, regional replicas, data replication, automatic failover, multi-regional services, and eliminate cross-region dependencies.

data.label: Create redundancy
data.shortDescription: Ensure no single points of failure, replicate resources across multiple failure domains (zones, regions), and use zonal DNS for isolation.

data.label: Eliminate scalability bottlenecks
data.shortDescription: Identify and eliminate resource who cant scale to your demands

data.label: Minimize critical dependencies
data.shortDescription: Minimize critical dependencies, increase redundancy, use asynchronous requests, cache responses, prioritize queues, serve from cache, fail safe, degrade gracefully

data.label: Define goals
data.shortDescription: define appropriate ways to measure the customer experience of your services so you can run reliable services
